title: The heart of Midlothian;
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Specimens continued within the memory of man to be kept at least at three houses of distinction — Hamilton, namely, Drumlanrig, and Cumbernauld.

title: Rambles in Europe:
author: Morrison, Leonard Allison
snippet: Stark or Starke is a Scottish surname, meaning  strong, and was first borne by a person by name of Muirhead, for his having rescued King James IV from a bull in the forest of Cumbernauld.

title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: Claudero was a native of Cumbernauld, in Dumbartonshire,  and at an early period of his life showed such marks of a mischief-loving disposition, as procured him general odium.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: " My friend fra' Perthshire," he said to the stalwartHighlander," ye are hereby appointed Maister o' theHorse to Monsieur Lestrange ; and I hae nae doot butthat ye'll perform the duties o' yer office wi' maircredit than yer humble servant; for, as ye may easilysee, I'm no verra supple, thanks to the minister o'Cumbernauld, wha didna' think shame to larne a puirladdie for throwin' a stane."

title: Great Britain, France and Belgium: a short tour in 1835
author: Humphrey, Heman
snippet: ninth; in Cumbernauld, afourteenth, and in New Monkland, a twelfth.
